search_information.query_displayed: Socialization and Mobility in Educational and Early Occupational Attainment Porter, James N. Sociology of Education

organic_results.title: Socialization and mobility in educational and early occupational attainment
organic_results.snippet: This paper attempts to clarify how socialization and mobility processes are related, using a longitudinal study of a national sample of white males. The roles of two types of mental ability (creativity and intelligence) and two aspects of personality (conformity and ambition) are contrasted using a path model of the educational and early occupational attainment processes. The model views social-psychological variables as mediating social-structural variables: significant others respond to a boy on the basis of his abilities and social origins …

publication_info.summary: JN Porter - Sociology of Education, 1976 - JSTOR
